indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Marco Político y Estratégico para el manejo de las Áreas Protegidas desarrollado.

baseline.comment: No existe Plan de Gestión de las Áreas Protegidas.

target.comment: to desing a Diseñado AWP FOR year 2016 To design Conceptual model for SPAN to condcut METT.Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool (METT). ito conduct PABAT in protected areas To conduct Evaluacion ambiental estrategica To stablish a gender maestriming and intercultural policy in programs and projects to stablish technical steering comite to apply 2 Reserves of Biosphere one in Island and second in continent

actual.comment: Baseline elaborated trought METT and PABAT. Gender and intercultural startegic plan conducted and approved CONCEPTUAL MODEL WAS IN PLACE AND APPROVED BY MINISTRY INTERMINISTERIAL WORKING GROUP WAS ESTABLISHED AND START HIS JOB MANAGEMENTS PLANS WAS REVISED AND CARTOGRAPHIED. MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR SCIENTIFIC RESERVE GRAN CALDERA DE LUBA AND PICO BASILE NATIONAL PARK IS IN PLACE NEW ZONIFICATION FOR PROTECTED AREAS WAS DONE. STEERING COMMITE FOR RESERVES OF BIOSPHERE WAS CONSTITUTED AND START WORKING WITH TOW PROPOSALS:"RESERVA DE LA BIOSFERA ISLA DE BIOKO" Y "RESERVA DE LA BIOSFERA REGION CONTINENTAL".

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: A Policy framework and Strategy for the management of PAs is developed

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of revised policies and laws enacted/adopted

baseline.comment:
EG National Biodiversity Policy framework is non-functional.
Environmental sector laws are unclear and contradictory.
No environmental sector coordinating body exists.
EGâ€™s 20-year national development plan is not carbon neutral.

target.comment:
By 2011 a revised National Biodiversity Policy enacted that supports a role for NGOs and community organizations in biodiversity management
By 2012 a new environmental sector law clearly defines complementary roles and responsibilities for MdePyMA, MdeAyB, and INDEFOR
By 2011 an environmental sector coordinating body created, staffed, and budgeted.
By 2012 EGâ€™s 20-year national development plan revised to be carbon neutral.

actual.comment:
The project team reviewed all laws relating to environmental, forestry and protected areas.
The project team, has carried out a study and has given the necessary recommendations to address the problem of scattered and contradictory legislation.
the document produced by the project team has been high at the level of the Council of Ministers for its consideration, in the month of June 2015

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Change in amount of FONAMA and FONADEFO financial disbursements

target.comment: By 2012 FONAMA and FONADEFO are dispersing 50% of recurrent and operational costs of NSPA and biodiversity management including grants to Guinean conservation NGOs.

actual.comment: At this point, you are waiting for decisions at the level of the Government of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea referred to in the recommendations drawn up by the management of the project team

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Improved institutional and individual capacities for the management of PAs

actual.comment:
Since October (incorporation of the CTS) 2014 to date, have been held 6 seminars for training and capacity-building of technicians, Rangers, ecoguardas and volunteers.
More than 65 people have improved their capacities for management, guardianship and custody of protected areas. Both of which are target of the project(4) and the rest of protected areas(9) of Equatorial Guinea.
Is relevant the Symposium about the future of protected areas from the island of Bioko, held on 11 and 12 June, in which more than 90 people: politicians, municipal, regional officials as well as members of civil society received information on actions to follow the project: elaboration of natural resource management plans; elaboration of plans of management and use of the two protected areas of the island of Bioko.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Management Effectiveness of PAs at project sites as measured by the METT Scorecard

baseline.comment:
Pico BasilÃ© NP 13.5%
Caldera de Luba Scientific Reserve 27.1%
Monte Alen NP 37.5%
RÃ­o MunÃ­ Natural Reserve 16.7%
RÃ­o Campo Natural Reserve 19.8%

target.comment:
Pico BasilÃ© NP 25%
Caldera de Luba Scientific Reserve 40%
Monte Alen NP 50%
RÃ­o MunÃ­ Natural Reserve 25%
RÃ­o Campo Natural Reserve 25%

actual.comment:
December 2014 the METT surveys were conducted in protected areas subject to the partners the METT full SNAP surveys were conducted in March.
also we conduct PA-BAT survey in 13 Protected Areas of SPAN. .
The project team has published and shared outcomes. It was also applied in the National Park of Monte Alen, the VET method .
Exercise also involved NGOs that develop their work in Protected Areas and civil society

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description:
Improved financial sustainability for NSPA, as measured by the
Financial Sustainability Scorecard

baseline.comment:
Legal and regulatory framework
11.5% - 9 out of 78
Business planning
11.5% - 7 out of 61
Tools for revenue generation
3.5% - 2 out of 57
Total
9.2% - 18 out of 196

actual.comment: Datasheets of generating income in each protected area objective project activities have been developed. It has developed an informative manual for the measurement of the carbon and an exercise being done in the National Park of Monte Alen

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Sustainable PA management approaches demonstrated in 3 pilot sites

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of new or revised management plans

baseline.comment: Recent management plans exist only for Monte Alen and RÃ­o Campo. There are no management plans for the Monte Alen/RÃ­o MunÃ­ landscape or for the Caldera de Luba/Pico BasilÃ© landscape.

target.comment: By 2010 updated management plans exist for Monte Alen, RÃ­o MunÃ­, Caldera de Luba, Pico BasilÃ©, and RÃ­o Campo

actual.comment:
Team project along with national and international consultants have prepared the following documents:
-conceptual design of the national system of areas protected.
-strategy for the INSTITUTIONALIZATION of gender approaches and INTERCULTURALITY. MAINSTREAMING APPROACHES TO EQUALITY IN THE FORMULATION OF PLANS, PROGRAMMES AND PROJECTS.
Guide for the design and formulation of plans General of management of the Areas protected from Equatorial Guinea project GEF-SNAP. 4185 PIMS.
The team project along with national and international consultants have revised and updated the following plans:
-Management Plan National Park of Monte Alen-Plan of management of the natural reserve of Rio Campo.Ha started to prepare
the plans of management of resources natural: Monte Alen and reserve a scientific National Park caldera de luba

baseline.comment: No organized, profitable ecotourism exists based on Bioko Island\\\'s rare and endangered primates and birds

target.comment: By 2012 a business plan for primate- and bird-focused ecotourism on Bioko exists

actual.comment: in drafting the guiding document for the national strategy for green tourism in Guinea Ecuatorial.En collaboration with the Ministry of tourism and the private sector and civil society agencies

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Percent of crop damage that is mitigated

baseline.comment: Crop damage from wild animals is unmanaged and unmitigated

target.comment: By 2012 a quantitative survey of credible wild crop damage exists and a plan for appropriate mitigation prepared and submitted to the GoEG

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Gazetting of the Bioko Forest Corridor

baseline.comment: The critical ecological transect between the Caldera de Luba and Pico BasilÃ©, and the wild animals moving between the two, are unprotected, unmanaged, and vulnerable to forest conversion

target.comment: By 2012 the Bioko Forest Corridor is gazetted

actual.comment: Processing document to create the reserve of the biosphere of island of Bioko, which contemplates the creation of the Corredor.En paper on legislative recommendations included: - Marine Areas - BiokoCorredor of Monte alen-estuary of Muni broker

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Existence of MdePyMA field management unit for the Bioko Forest Corridor

baseline.comment: No management authority has an effective presence on Bioko Island

target.comment: By 2012 MdePyMA has established a 5-person field management unit assigned to the Bioko Forest Corridor
